LouwNidaCodes66.Uni: 1A Universe, Creation; 14 Physical Events and States

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words referring to the physical universe. Some languages may not have a single word for the universe and may have to use a phrase such as 'rain, soil, and things of the sky' or 'sky, land, and water' or a descriptive phrase such as 'everything you can see' or 'everything that exists'.
Use this domain for words related to the sky.

Use this domain for words related to the sun. The sun does three basic things. It moves, it gives light, and it gives heat. These three actions are involved in the meanings of most of the words in this domain. Since the sun moves below the horizon, many words refer to it setting or rising. Since the sun is above the clouds, many words refer to it moving behind the clouds and the clouds blocking its light. The sun's light and heat also produce secondary effects. The sun causes plants to grow, and it causes damage to things.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words refer to the sun?
Quels sont les mots pour parler du soleil?

ExampleWords67.AUni: sun, solar, sol, daystar, our star

Question67.AUni: (2) What words refer to how the sun moves?

ExampleWords67.AUni: rise, set, cross the sky, come up, go down, sink

Question67.AUni: (3) What words refer to the time when the sun rises?
Quels sont les mots qui signifient le lever du soleil?

AStr.Run: We got up before <dawn>, in order to get an early start.

Question67.AUni: (4) What words refer to the time when the sun is at its highest point?
(5) What words refer to the time when the sun sets?
Quels sont les mots qui signifient le coucher du soleil?
(6) What words refer to when the sun is shining?
Quels sont les mots pour le soleil qui brille?

ExampleWords67.AUni: shine, sunny, bright, give light, be sunshiny, daytime,

Question67.AUni: (7) What words refer to the sun shining through the clouds?

ExampleWords67.AUni: come out, break through (the clouds), go behind (a cloud)
Il fait du soleil, il fait jour, le jour

Question67.AUni: (8) What words describe where the sun is shining?
Quels sont les mots pour l'endroit où le soleil répand sa lumière?

ExampleWords67.AUni: sunlit, be (out) in the sun, lit by the sun, shine on, be in the sunlight, sunny (spot)

Question67.AUni: (9) What words describe when or where the sun doesn't shine?
Quels sont les mots pour l'endroit et le moment où le soleil ne brille pas?

ExampleWords67.AUni: shade, eclipse of the sun, sunless, shady, shadow, eclipse (v),

Question67.AUni: (10) What words refer to the light of the sun?
Quels sont les mots pour la lumière du soleil?

ExampleWords67.AUni: sunlight, ray, sunshine, beam, light, sunbeam, radiance, glow, sparkle, glisten, glare

Question67.AUni: (11) What words describe the brightness of the sun?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent la brillance du soleil?

ExampleWords67.AUni: bright, intense, brilliant, blinding, glaring, glistening, luminous, dim

Question67.AUni: (12) What refer to the sun heating things?
(13) What else does the sun do?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent les effets du soleil?

ExampleWords67.AUni: chauffer, sécher, répandre lumière, faire pousser les choses

Question67.AUni: (14) What words describe the damage done by sunlight?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent les problèmes causés par le soleil?

ExampleWords67.AUni: sunburn, sunstroke, suntan, tan, heatstroke, heat prostration, sun damage, fading from the sun, bleached by the sun
un coup de soleil, quelque chose qui perd sa couleur dans le soleil, etc.

Question67.AUni: (15) What do people use to protect themselves from the sun?
Qu'est-ce que les gens utilisent pour se protéger contre le soleil?

ExampleWords67.AUni: sunglasses, shade tree, suntan lotion, awning, sun umbrella, parasol, sunbonnet, hat, visor
lunettes de soleil, ombre, arbre, parasol, chapeau

Question67.AUni: (16) What words are used of telling time by the sun?
Quels sont les mots qui signifient dire l'heure par le soleil?

ExampleWords67.AUni: sundial, angle of the sun, sun-clock, shoot the sun, position of the sun,

Question67.AUni: (17) What words refer to using the power of the sun?

ExampleWords67.AUni: solar energy, solar power, solar panel

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the moon. In your culture people may believe things about the moon. For instance in European culture people used to believe that the moon caused people to become crazy. So in English we have words like "moon-struck" and "lunatic." You should include such words in this domain.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words refer to the moon?
(2) What words refer to how the moon moves?

ExampleWords67.AUni: clair de lune, rayon de lune

Question67.AUni: (3) What words refer to the time when the moon rises?
Quels sont les mots qui signifient le lever de la lune?
(4) What words refer to the time when the moon sets?
Quels sont les mots qui signifient le coucher de la lune?
(5) What words refer to when the moon is shining?
Quels sont les mots qu'on utilise quand la lune brille?

ExampleWords67.AUni: moon is shining, by the light of the moon, moon is/comes out,
Il fait du soleil, il fait jour, le jour

Question67.AUni: (6) What words describe where the moon is shining?
Quels sont les mots pour l'endroit où la lune brille?

ExampleWords67.AUni: moonlit, be in the moonlight, lit by the moon, shine on,

Question67.AUni: (7) What words describe when or where the moon doesn't shine?
Quels sont les mots pour le moment et l'endroit où la lune ne brille pas?

ExampleWords67.AUni: moonless night, eclipse of the moon, eclipse (v),
une nuit sans lune, éclipse de la lune

Question67.AUni: (8) What words refer to the light of the moon?
Quels sont les mots qui correspondent à la lumière de la lune?
(9) What words describe the brightness of the moon?
(10) What words describe the appearance of the moon?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent l'apparence de la lune?

ExampleWords67.AUni: man in the moon, harvest moon
(est-ce qu'on voit un animal ou une personne dans les contours de la pleine lune, par exemple?)

Question67.AUni: (11) What words refer to the spots on the moon?
(12) What words refer to the phases of the moon?
Quels sont les mots qui signifient les phases de la lune?

ExampleWords67.AUni: phase, new moon, full moon, half moon, quarter moon, crescent, sliver, moon is waxing (getting bigger), moon is waning (getting smaller), wax and wane

Question67.AUni: (13) What words refer to the time it takes for the moon to go through its phases?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the stars and other heavenly bodies.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words are used to refer to the stars?
Quels sont les mots pour parler des étoiles?
(2) What words describe the sky when the stars are shining?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent le ciel quand les étoiles brillent?

ExampleWords67.AUni: starlit (sky), (sky is) ablaze with stars, starry (sky), star studded (sky), stars are shining

Question67.AUni: (3) What words are used for where the stars are shining?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent l'endroit où les étoiles brillent?

ExampleWords67.AUni: étoilé, illuminé par les étoiles, baigné par la lumière des étoiles

Question67.AUni: (4) What words are used for when or where the stars don't shine?
Quels sont les mots pour l'endroit et le moment où les étoiles ne brillent pas?

ExampleWords67.AUni: une nuit / un ciel sans étoiles

Question67.AUni: (5) What words refer to the light of the stars?
Quels sont les mots qui signifient la lumière des étoiles?
(6) What words describe the brightness of the stars?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent la brillance des étoiles?
(7) What words describe the appearance of the stars?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent l'apparence des étoiles?

ExampleWords67.AUni: clignoter, la forme d'une étoile, scintiller

Question67.AUni: (8) What words refer to the study of the stars?
Quels sont les mots qui correspondent aux personnes qui regardent ou qui étudient les étoiles?

ExampleWords67.AUni: astronomy, astronomer, astrology, astrologer, stargazer, magi

Question67.AUni: (9) What is a group of stars called?
Comment s'appelle un groupe d'étoiles?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to planets (large objects that circle the sun, looking like bright wandering stars in the sky), comets (objects that circle the sun, looking like a star with a tail), meteors (small objects that come from space and burn up when they hit the earth's atmosphere, causing a streak of light across the sky), and asteroids (small objects that circle the sun), planetary moons (large objects that circle the planets). Some cultures do not study the stars and will have few or no words in this domain. Others cultures that study the stars will have many words. There are only five planets that people can see in the sky--Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn. The others are only known from the scientific study of astronomy.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words refer to a planet?
Quels sont les mots qu'on utilise pour une planète?
(2) What are the names of the planets?
Quels sont les noms des planètes/

ExampleWords67.AUni: Mercury, Venus (Morning Star, Evening Star), Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto

Question67.AUni: (3) What words refer to how the planets move?
Que font les planètes?

ExampleWords67.AUni: traverser le ciel, aller autour du soleil

Question67.AUni: (4) What words refer to the sun and planets?
(5) What words refer to comets?
(6) What do comets do?
Que font les comètes?
(7) What words refer to meteors?

ExampleWords67.AUni: meteor, shooting star, falling star, meteor trail, meteor shower

Question67.AUni: (8) What do meteors do?
Que font les météores?

ExampleWords67.AUni: flash across the sky, blaze a trail across the sky, strike the earth, make a crater, burn up
traverser le ciel, laisser une trace, faire un cratère

Question67.AUni: (9) What words are used for when a meteor hits the earth?
Quels sont les mots qu'on utilise quand un météore frappe la terre?
(10) What is a small planet called?
Comment est-ce qu'on appelle une petite planète

(ciel et) terre, (par) terre, (de retour à la) terre solide, terra firma

Quels sont les mots qui signifient la planète où nous sommes?

Est-ce qu'il y a un mot ou une phrase qui signifie tout ce qui vit, comprenant les plantes aussi bien que les animaux?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to the spirits of things.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words refer to the spirits of things?
Est-ce qu'il y a un mot ou une phrase qui signifie tout ce qui vit, comprenant les plantes aussi bien que les animaux?
(2) What words refer to talking to the spirits?
(3) What words refer to worshiping spirits?
(4) What words refer to things used to worship spirits?
(1) What words refer to all living things, including both plants and animals?
Est-ce qu'il y a un mot ou une phrase qui signifie tout ce qui vit, comprenant les plantes aussi bien que les animaux?

ExampleWords67.AUni: living things, life, all life, every living thing, everything that lives and breathes, plants and animals, organic matter

Question67.AUni: (2) What words refer to something that is alive?
(3) What words refer to being alive?

ExampleWords67.AUni: tissue, cell, membrane, DNA, gene, protoplasm
les choses vivantes, la vie, tout ce qui vit, faune et flore, les plantes et les animaux

ExampleWords67.AUni: biology, biologist, life science, ecology, ecologist, natural history, naturalist

Question67.AUni: (7) What words refer to whether a plant or animal can be eaten?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words for all plants. Use a book of pictures to identify plant names and the scientific name. Languages divide plants into various domains that are not always comparable from language to language. Criterial features may be characteristics (trees and bushes are distinguished by size and number of trunks) and use (grass and weeds are distinguished by their desirability). A common distinction is between trees and non-trees, with trees described as being big, woody, and having a life expectancy of several years, while non-trees are small, non-woody, and have a life expectancy of typically not more than one year (Heine, Bernd and Karsten Legere. 1995. Swahili plants. Rudiger Koppe Verlag: Koln.). Agricultural societies will divide plants into wild and cultivated. However most plants for which there are names have some use. Therefore it does not seem helpful to divide plant names into domains for useful and non-useful plants. Since only parts of plants are eaten, edible parts of plants are listed under the domain 'Food'. Some languages may have more domains than are used in this list, others may have fewer. The classification system used here does not agree entirely with the system used by botanists. For instance botanists do not classify all the tree species together. The palm trees belong to the class Monocotyledoneae and are classified with lilies, bananas, and orchids. Apple and cherry trees belong to the class Dicotyledoneae and are classified in the rose family along with roses and blackberries. The acacia tree also belongs to the class Dicotyledoneae and is classified in the pulse family along with lupines and beans. However most folk taxonomies bring all the trees together. The scientific classification system for plants and animals is taken from: Carruth, Gorton, ed. 1989. The Volume Library, Vols. 1 and 2. The Southwestern Company: Nashville.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words refer to all plants?
Quel mot signifie toutes les plantes, en général?
(2) What words describe types of plants?

ExampleWords67.AUni: angiosperm, annual, aquatic, biennial, bracken, brake, creeper, deciduous, edible, flower, greens, herbaceous, hybrid, leafy, legume, luscious, parasite, perennial, plankton, pulse, sedge, succulent, tropical, vegetable, vine, weed, woody, wort

Question67.AUni: (3) What words are used to describe plants that grow wild?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent les plantes qui ne sont pas cultivées, qui poussent naturellement dans la forêt ou la brousse?
(4) What words refer to cultivated plants?
(5) What words refer to a group of plants?

ExampleWords67.AUni: bale, bouquet, bracken, brush, bunch, canopy, clump, cluster, cover, covert, corsage, crop, culture, forest, greenery, grove, growth, hassock, haystack, herbage, jungle, kelp, nosegay, orchard, scrub, sheaf, shock, shrubbery, skein, spray, stand, sward, thicket, tuft, turf, tussock, underbrush, undergrowth, vegetation, verdure, vermin

Question67.AUni: (6) What words refer to the study of plants?

Quels sont les mots qui font référence à tout ce qu'on peut voir?

Use this domain for general words for a person or all mankind.

LouwNidaCodes66.Uni: 8 Body, Body Parts, and Body Products; 8A Body; 8B Parts of the Body

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words for the whole human body, and general words for any part of the body. Use a drawing or photo to label each part. Some words may be more general than others are and include some of the other words. For instance 'head' is more general than 'face' or 'nose'. Be sure that both general and specific parts are labeled.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words refer to the body?
(2) What words refer to the shape of a person's body?
(3) What general words refer to a part of the body?

ExampleWords67.AUni: part of the body, body part, anatomy, appendage, member, orifice,

Question67.AUni: (4) What words describe something about your body?
(5) What words refer to cells?

LouwNidaCodes66.Uni: 8C Physiological Products of the Body; 23 Physiological Processes and States

Name7.AUni: Fonctions du corps, Actions du corps

AStr.Run: Use this domain for the functions and actions of the whole body. Use the subdomains in this section for functions, actions, secretions, and products of various parts of the body. In each domain include any special words that are used of animals.

Question67.AUni: (1) What general words refer to the functions of the body?
(2) What general words refer to secretions of the body?

ExampleWords67.AUni: secrete, secretion, excrete, excretion, product, fluid, body fluids, discharge, flux,

Question67.AUni: (3) What words refer to bile?

ExampleWords67.AUni: bile, gall (fluid from the liver stored in the gall bladder)

LouwNidaCodes66.Uni: 24 Sensory Events and States; 24G General Sensory Perception

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words related to all the senses--sight, hearing, smell, taste, and feeling. Some languages may not distinguish some of these senses, and some languages may have words for other senses. There are also other senses that animals have. If your language has words for other senses, include them here.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words refer to sensing something using one of the senses?
Quels sont les verbes qui signifient déterminer quelque chose par les sens?

ExampleWords67.AUni: feel, sense, perceive, notice, detect, distinguish

Question67.AUni: (2) What words refer to the ability to sense something?
(3) What words refer to all the senses?
Quel nom correspond à tous les sens: de vue, de goût, d'ouïe, de toucher?
(4) What words refer to something that you sense?
(5) What words describe something that can be sensed?
(6) What words describe something that cannot be sensed?

ExampleWords67.AUni: unperceived, imperceptible, unnoticeable, undetectable, undetected, indistinguishable,

Question67.AUni: (7) What words describe someone who can sense things better than other people?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words related to the condition of the body.

Question67.AUni: (1) What general words refer to the condition of the body?

ExampleWords67.AUni: condition, state, shape (as in 'to be in shape')

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to a person being healthy--not sick.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words describe a person who is healthy?
Quels sont les mots qui décrivent une personne en bonne santé?

ExampleWords67.AUni: healthy, well, fine, in good health, able-bodied, hale, sound, whole,

Question67.AUni: (2) What words describe someone who is healthy and doesn't get sick?
(3) What words describe someone who looks healthy?

ExampleWords67.AUni: glowing, be the picture of health, healthy-looking,

Question67.AUni: (4) What words refer to the state of being healthy?
Quels sont les mots qui signifient être en bonne santé?
(5) What words refer to a person's physical condition?
Quels sont les mots pour indiquer la condition physique de quelqu'un (si la personne est malade ou pas?)
(6) What words describe something that makes you healthy?

ExampleWords67.AUni: healthy, be good for you, be good for your health, do you good, beneficial,

Question67.AUni: (7) What words describe food that makes you healthy?

OcmCodes66.Uni: 761 Life and Death; 159 Life History Materials

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words referring to being alive and to a person's lifetime.

Question67.AUni: (1) What words refer to being alive?

ExampleWords67.AUni: be alive, live, life, stay alive, be going strong,

Question67.AUni: (2) What words describe someone who is alive?

ExampleWords67.AUni: être en vie, la vie, vivre

Question67.AUni: (3) What words refer to the process a person goes through from birth to death?

ExampleWords67.AUni: life, life cycle, cycle of life

Question67.AUni: (4) What words refer to the time when a person is alive?

ExampleWords67.AUni: life, lifetime, days, lifespan, life expectancy,

Question67.AUni: (5) What words refer to causing someone to be alive?

ExampleWords67.AUni: animate (v), bring to life, give life to, give breath to, breathe life into, vivify

Question67.AUni: (6) What words refer to bringing a dead person back to life?

ExampleWords67.AUni: resurrect, resurrection, resuscitate, revive, rise again, rise from the dead, regenerate, bring back to life

Question67.AUni: (7) What words refer to keeping someone alive?

ExampleWords67.AUni: keep alive, life support, preserve, sustain, subsist on,

Question67.AUni: (8) What words refer to living longer than someone else?
(9) What words refer to having a particular kind of life?

ExampleWords67.AUni: a good/bad/hard life, a life of crime/poverty, a miserable/lonely existence, lead a good/bad/hard life, live well/happily,

Question67.AUni: (10) What words refer to the kind of life a person lives?
(11) What words indicate that something is true of your whole life?

ExampleWords67.AUni: all your life, for life, lifelong,

Question67.AUni: (1) What words refer to a single member of the human race?

ExampleWords67.AUni: person, human being, man, individual, figure

Question67.AUni: (2) What words refer to a person when you aren't sure who the person is?
(3) What words refer to more than one person?

ExampleWords67.AUni: people, folks, population, the public, populace,

Question67.AUni: (4) What words refer to the entire human race?

ExampleWords67.AUni: man, men, mankind, the human race, humanity, humankind,

Question67.AUni: (5) What words describe something characteristic of all people?
(6) What words describe something characteristic of one person?
(7) What words refer to no person?

AStr.Run: This is a fake new domain created for test purposes to own an existing domain.

Use this domain for general words referring to mental and verbal activity. This domain is primarily for grouping many related domains. Therefore there may be no general word in a language to cover such a broad area of meaning.

Question67.AUni: (1) What general words refer to mental and verbal activity?
(1) Why is there air?
